verses.verse: Then Yahweh <S%H3068><s%> answered <S%H6030><s%> Job <S%H347><s%> out of the whirlwind, <S%H5591><s%>
"Who is this who darkens <S%H2821><s%> counsel <S%H6098><s%> by words <S%H4405><s%> without knowledge? <S%H1847><s%>
Brace <S%H247><s%> yourself <S%H2504><s%> like a man, <S%H1397><s%> for I will question <S%H7592><s%> you, <S%H3045><s%> then you answer me!
"Where <S%H375><s%> were you when I laid the foundations <S%H3245><s%> of the earth? <S%H776><s%> Declare, <S%H5046><s%> if you have <S%H3045><s%> understanding. <S%H998><s%>
Who determined <S%H7760><s%> its measures, <S%H4461><s%> if you know? <S%H3045><s%> Or who stretched <S%H5186><s%> the line on it? <S%H6957><s%>
Whereupon were its foundations <S%H134><s%> fastened? <S%H2883><s%> Or who laid <S%H3384><s%> its <S%H6438><s%> cornerstone, <S%H68><s%>
when the morning <S%H1242><s%> stars <S%H3556><s%> sang <S%H7442><s%> together, <S%H3162><s%> and all the sons <S%H1121><s%> of God <S%H430><s%> shouted for joy? <S%H7321><s%>
"Or who shut up <S%H5526><s%> the sea <S%H3220><s%> with doors, <S%H1817><s%> when it broke forth <S%H1518><s%> from <S%H3318><s%> the womb, <S%H7358><s%>
when I made <S%H7760><s%> clouds <S%H6051><s%> its garment, <S%H3830><s%> and wrapped <S%H2854><s%> it in thick darkness, <S%H6205><s%>
marked <S%H7665><s%> out for it my bound, <S%H2706><s%> set <S%H7760><s%> bars <S%H1280><s%> and doors, <S%H1817><s%>
and said, <S%H559><s%> <S%H5704><s%> 'Here you may come, <S%H935><s%> but no further. <S%H3254><s%> Here your proud <S%H1347><s%> waves <S%H1530><s%> shall be stayed? <S%H7896><s%>'
"Have you commanded <S%H6680><s%> the morning <S%H1242><s%> in your days, <S%H3117><s%> and caused the dawn <S%H7837><s%> to know <S%H3045><s%> its place; <S%H4725><s%>
that it might take hold <S%H270><s%> of the ends <S%H3671><s%> of the earth, <S%H776><s%> and shake the wicked <S%H7563><s%> out of it? <S%H5287><s%>
It is changed <S%H2015><s%> as clay <S%H2563><s%> under the seal, <S%H2368><s%> and stands <S%H3320><s%> forth as a garment. <S%H3830><s%>
From the wicked, <S%H7563><s%> their light <S%H216><s%> is withheld. <S%H4513><s%> The high <S%H7311><s%> arm <S%H2220><s%> is broken. <S%H7665><s%>
"Have you entered <S%H935><s%> into the springs <S%H5033><s%> of the sea? <S%H3220><s%> Or have you walked <S%H1980><s%> in the recesses <S%H2714><s%> of the deep? <S%H8415><s%>
Have the gates <S%H8179><s%> of death <S%H4194><s%> been revealed <S%H1540><s%> to you? <S%H7200><s%> Or have you seen the gates <S%H8179><s%> of the shadow of death? <S%H6757><s%>
Have you comprehended <S%H995><s%> the earth <S%H776><s%> in its breadth? <S%H7338><s%> Declare, <S%H5046><s%> if you know it all. <S%H3045><s%>
"What is the way <S%H1870><s%> to the dwelling <S%H7931><s%> of light? <S%H216><s%> As for darkness, <S%H2822><s%> where is its place, <S%H4725><s%>
that you should take <S%H3947><s%> it to its bound, <S%H1366><s%> that you should discern <S%H995><s%> the paths <S%H5410><s%> to its house? <S%H1004><s%>
Surely you know, <S%H3045><s%> for you were born <S%H3205><s%> then, <S%H4557><s%> and the number of your days <S%H3117><s%> is great! <S%H7227><s%>
Have you entered <S%H935><s%> the treasuries <S%H214><s%> of the snow, <S%H7950><s%> or have you seen <S%H7200><s%> the treasures <S%H214><s%> of the hail, <S%H1259><s%>
which I have reserved <S%H2820><s%> against the time <S%H6256><s%> of trouble, <S%H6862><s%> against the day <S%H3117><s%> of battle <S%H7128><s%> and war? <S%H7128><s%>
By what <S%H335><s%> way <S%H1870><s%> is the lightning <S%H216><s%> distributed, <S%H216><s%> or the east wind <S%H6921><s%> scattered <S%H6327><s%> on the earth? <S%H776><s%>
Who has cut <S%H6385><s%> a channel <S%H8585><s%> for the flood water, <S%H7858><s%> or the path <S%H1870><s%> for the <S%H2385><s%> thunderstorm; <S%H6963><s%>
To cause it to rain <S%H4305><s%> on a land <S%H776><s%> where no man <S%H376><s%> is; <S%H4057><s%> on the wilderness, in which there is no man; <S%H120><s%>
to satisfy <S%H7646><s%> the waste <S%H4875><s%> and desolate <S%H7722><s%> ground, <S%H4161><s%> to cause the tender grass <S%H1877><s%> to spring forth? <S%H6779><s%>
Does the rain <S%H4306><s%> have <S%H3426><s%> a father? <S%H1><s%> Or who fathers <S%H3205><s%> the drops <S%H96><s%> of dew? <S%H2919><s%>
Out of whose womb <S%H990><s%> came <S%H3318><s%> the ice? <S%H7140><s%> The gray frost <S%H3713><s%> of the sky, <S%H8064><s%> who has given birth to it? <S%H3205><s%>
The waters <S%H4325><s%> become hard <S%H2244><s%> like stone, <S%H68><s%> when the surface <S%H6440><s%> of the deep <S%H8415><s%> is frozen. <S%H3920><s%>
"Can you bind <S%H7194><s%> the cluster <S%H4575><s%> of the Pleiades, <S%H3598><s%> or loosen <S%H6605><s%> the cords <S%H4189><s%> of Orion? <S%H3685><s%>
Can you lead forth <S%H3318><s%> the constellations <S%H4216><s%> in their season? <S%H6256><s%> Or can you guide <S%H5148><s%> the Bear <S%H5906><s%> with her cubs? <S%H1121><s%>
Do you know <S%H3045><s%> the laws <S%H2708><s%> of the heavens? <S%H8064><s%> Can you establish <S%H7760><s%> its dominion <S%H4896><s%> over the earth? <S%H776><s%>
"Can you lift up <S%H7311><s%> your voice <S%H6963><s%> to the clouds, <S%H5645><s%> That abundance <S%H8229><s%> of waters <S%H4325><s%> may cover you? <S%H3680><s%>
Can you send <S%H7971><s%> forth lightnings, <S%H1300><s%> that they may go? <S%H3212><s%> Do they report to you, <S%H559><s%> 'Here we are?'
Who has put <S%H7896><s%> wisdom <S%H2451><s%> in the inward parts? <S%H2910><s%> Or who has given <S%H5414><s%> understanding <S%H998><s%> to the mind? <S%H7907><s%>
Who can number <S%H5608><s%> the clouds <S%H7834><s%> by wisdom? <S%H2451><s%> Or who can pour <S%H7901><s%> out the bottles <S%H5035><s%> of the sky, <S%H8064><s%>
when the dust <S%H6083><s%> runs <S%H3332><s%> into a mass, <S%H4165><s%> and the clods <S%H7263><s%> of earth stick together? <S%H1692><s%>
"Can you hunt <S%H6679><s%> the prey <S%H2964><s%> for the lioness, <S%H3833><s%> or satisfy <S%H4390><s%> the appetite <S%H2416><s%> of the young lions, <S%H3715><s%>
when they crouch <S%H7817><s%> in their dens, <S%H4585><s%> <S%H3427><s%> and <S%H3926><s%> lie in wait <S%H695><s%> in the thicket? <S%H5521><s%>

Who provides <S%H3559><s%> for the raven <S%H6158><s%> his prey, <S%H6718><s%> when his young ones <S%H3206><s%> cry <S%H7768><s%> to God, <S%H410><s%> and wander <S%H8582><s%> for lack <S%H1097><s%> of food? <S%H400><s%>
